Description:
Production Supervisor (Joinery / Carpentry)Position Overview:The Production Supervisor in Joinery / Carpentry is a key role in ensuring the efficient and effective manufacturing of joinery products. This position involves overseeing daily operations, managing production teams, and maintaining high-quality standards within the joinery workshop. The Production Supervisor plays a critical role in meeting production targets, optimizing resources, and ensuring product quality.Key Responsibilities:Team Management:Led, motivated, and managed production staff in the joinery workshop.
Assign tasks, set goals, and monitor individual and team performance.
Conduct training and development activities to enhance the skills of the production team.Production Planning:Collaborate with the production manager and project managers to develop production schedules and timelines.
Ensure that production plans align with project requirements, deadlines, and resource availability.
Make adjustments to schedules as needed to meet changing demands.Quality Control:Implement and enforce quality control procedures to maintain high standards of joinery product quality.
Conduct regular inspections of finished products to identify and address defects or issues.
Work with the quality assurance team to continuously improve product quality.Resource Allocation:Allocate manpower, equipment, and materials efficiently to maximize production output.
Coordinate with procurement and inventory teams to ensure the availability of raw materials and components.
Monitor inventory levels to prevent shortages and excesses.Production Efficiency:Streamline production processes and workflows to optimize efficiency and minimize waste.
Identify and resolve bottlenecks or production delays.
Promote a culture of continuous improvement within the production team.Health and Safety:Enforce safety protocols and ensure a safe working environment for all production staff.
Conduct safety training and address any safety concerns promptly.Documentation and Reporting:Maintain accurate records of production activities, including work orders, production reports, and quality control documentation.
Generate regular reports on production performance, efficiency, and quality.Problem Solving:Identify and address production-related issues, equipment malfunctions, and process inefficiencies.
Collaborate with maintenance teams to ensure equipment reliability.Skills
Skills:
Bachelor's degree in Production Management, Woodworking Technology, or related field (preferred)
Minimum 5 years proven experience as a Production Supervisor in the joinery or woodworking industry.
In-depth knowledge of joinery manufacturing processes, materials, and equipment.
Strong leadership and team management skills.
Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
Proficiency in using production management software and tools.
Understanding of health and safety regulations in a manufacturing environment.
Attention to detail and commitment to quality.
Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
